header_summary:
Hunter Beast's update on the specification introduces FALCON, incorporating Antoine's suggestions to address the integration of two different post-quantum cryptosystems, which notably increases the maintenance requirements. This change, detailed in [the GitHub pull request](https://github.com/cryptoquick/bips/pull/9/files), reflects a commitment to enhancing system resilience against future cryptographic challenges.

Matt Corallo discusses the vulnerabilities of Bitcoin pooled mining to block withholding attacks, emphasizing the necessity of statistical analysis for detection. He further critiques the Stratum V2 work selection process, suggesting that the autonomy it grants miners in choosing their work is crucial for maintaining Bitcoin's decentralization and reinforcing the network's integrity, as detailed in [this source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/26322ee8-08e6-4718-8d1c-60bca8c13c6a@mattcorallo.com/T/#m0a18615b7f96af4c21a5ce4207b435a6c476a1f1).

The lack of a foundational argument for Distributed Denial of Service (DoS) threats via onion messages, as discussed by MattCorallo, highlights a proactive stance towards potential vulnerabilities without a thorough analysis of the risks or effectiveness of proposed mitigation strategies. This discussion is available in more detail at [this link](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/onion-messaging-dos-threat-mitigations/1058/2).

Lastly, t-bast raises critical points about the vulnerabilities and design considerations in cryptocurrency wallets, focusing on the management of contacts and payment codes. The conversation underscores the importance of designing wallet interfaces that clearly communicate the association between contacts and payment codes, while also reflecting on the broader challenge of user education in secure payment practices. Further information can be found [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bolt-12-trusted-contacts/1046/5).

recent_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
recent_posts.summary:
- Block withholding attacks in Bitcoin mining pools harm their success rates.
- Defense against these attacks relies on pools conducting thorough statistical analyses.
- Stratum V2's autonomy in work selection promotes Bitcoin's decentralization and miner empowerment.

recent_posts.title: Onion Messaging DoS Threat Mitigations
recent_posts.summary:
- The paper tackles mitigating DoS threats in onion messages without proving their existence.
- It focuses on preventing routing loops but lacks formal risk analysis of DoS attacks.
- Lightning developers agreed on a "backpressure" strategy for potential DoS issues, effectiveness unclear.

recent_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
recent_posts.summary:
- The conversation highlights risks in cryptocurrency wallets, especially misassociating payment codes with contacts.
- It discusses the impact of compromised contact keys and the necessary steps for organizations to mitigate risks.
- The importance of clear wallet interfaces and educating users on secure payment practices is emphasized.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests adding quantum resistance to Bitcoin via a new signature algorithm.
- It introduces the "QuBit" soft fork series, emphasizing timely action for Bitcoin's security.
- The document, available for community feedback, aims to proactively address quantum threats.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's design has block withholding risks, challenging for mining pools.
- A negotiated template approach could improve security and resistance against monopolization.
- The discussion suggests altering PoW and expanding nonce space to enhance bitcoin mining.

active_posts.title: Is it time to increase the blocksize cap?
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability debate underlines issues like high transaction fees affecting low-income users.
- There's concern over Bitcoin's base layer being exclusive to elites, contradicting its decentralized ethos.
- The author is disillusioned with Bitcoin favoring institutional interests over individual freedom.

active_posts.title: Zawy’s Alternating Timestamp Attack
active_posts.summary:
- Zawy's Alternating Timestamp Attack exploits Bitcoin Testnet 4 by manipulating block timestamps.
- It enables attackers to significantly increase block production beyond normal rates.
- A proposed softfork aims to mitigate such attacks by adjusting timestamp requirements.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels integrates bitcoin with the Lightning network to enhance bitcoin stability.
- It aims to reduce bitcoin's volatility by facilitating dollar balance creation without centralized risks.
- The project faces user experience challenges but explores innovative solutions for financial stability.

today_in_history_posts.title: Human readable checksum (verification code) to avoid errors on BTC public addresses
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- BTC addresses' error risk could be reduced with a new checksum code, 4DC.
- This 4DC would verify transactions, shown next to addresses in wallets and transactions.
- Implementing 4DC requires a standard checksum algorithm and could extend to other coins.

today_in_history_posts.title: Fee Budgets: A Possible Path Towards Unified Cost Functions For Lightning Pathfinding Problems
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network aims to enhance Bitcoin's scalability and decrease transaction fees.
- Pickhardt and Richter's 2021 method evaluates payment success for improved pathfinding algorithms.
- New pathfinding concepts could boost the Lightning Network's efficiency and reliability.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin aims for scalability with around 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for user transactions.
- Proposals include federated sidechains and Chaumian ecash banks, with coinpools as a leading solution.
- Emphasis on networked entities and market forces to ensure regulatory compliance and operational safety.
